content.question: A university researcher wants to estimate the mean number of novels that seniors read during their time in college. An exit survey was conducted with a random sample of 9 seniors. The sample mean was 7 novels with standard deviation 2.29 novels. Assuming that all conditions for conducting inference have been met, which of the following is a 95 percent confidence interval for the population mean number of novels read by all seniors?

choices.label: <math alttext="7 plus or minus 1.960, times the fraction with numerator 2.29, and denominator the square root of 8" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>7</mn><mo>±</mo><mn>1.960</mn><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>2.29</mn></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mn>8</mn></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="7 plus or minus 1.960, times the fraction with numerator 2.29, and denominator the square root of 9" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>7</mn><mo>±</mo><mn>1.960</mn><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>2.29</mn></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mn>9</mn></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="7 plus or minus 2.262, times the fraction with numerator 2.29, and denominator the square root of 9" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>7</mn><mo>±</mo><mn>2.262</mn><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>2.29</mn></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mn>9</mn></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="7 plus or minus 2.306, times the fraction with numerator 2.29, and denominator the square root of 8" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>7</mn><mo>±</mo><mn>2.306</mn><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>2.29</mn></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mn>8</mn></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="7 plus or minus 1.960, times the fraction with numerator 2.29, and denominator the square root of 9" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>7</mn><mo>±</mo><mn>2.306</mn><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>2.29</mn></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mn>9</mn></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="7 plus or minus 1.960, times the fraction with numerator 2.29, and denominator the square root of 9" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>7</mn><mo>±</mo><mn>2.306</mn><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>2.29</mn></mrow><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mn>9</mn></mrow></msqrt></mrow></mfrac></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

topic.text: 7.2: Constructing a Confidence Interval for a Population Mean

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Construct a confidence interval, provided conditions for inference are met.
